snippet: Corrections appearing in print on April 10, 2012.
A smartphone or tablet that uses the Apple or Android operating system is all it takes to process credit and debit cards, without the bulky machine that once was required.
abstract: Mobile card readers, small devices that plug into smartphones, allow entrepreneurs, trade show exhibitors and other small-business people to sell more of their products on the road, despite fact that many consumers now carry credit and debit cards instead of cash.

headline.main: Mobile Card-Processing Machines for Marketers on the Road

snippet: Instagram is in a position to help Facebook at the lucrative crossroads of pictures and mobile devices. Pictures are enormously important for Facebook, but it is not so easy to post a picture that you've taken on a cellphone onto your Facebook pag...
abstract: Instagram is in a position to help Facebook at the lucrative crossroads of pictures and mobile devices. Pictures are enormously important for Facebook, but it is not so easy to post a picture that you've taken on a cellphone onto your Facebook page from a mobile device. And cellphones are what we use these days to take pictures.

headline.main: Facebook Makes a Play for Mobile With Its Instagram Scoop

snippet: The automaker is revamping its development system to allow its engineers and designers to take more risks.
abstract: Toyota will give its engineers more freedom to experiment with bolder, more daring designs after decades of emphasizing staid reliability; will streamline design decisions by reducing the number of executives involved in review, while asking engineers to cut costs by using standard parts across different models.

headline.main: Toyota, Eschewing Sedate Design, Is Ready for Pizazz
headline.print_headline: Toyota, Eschewing Sedate Design, Is Ready for Pizazz

snippet: The lofty price Microsoft paid AOL for 800 patents — $1.3 million each — reflects the crucial role patents are playing in the business and legal strategies of technology companies.
abstract: Microsoft's $1.056 billion purchase of 800 patents held by AOL intensifies a global battle for intellectual property between the world's major technology companies; price significantly exceeds market predictions; sale reflects the particular importance of patents related to the lucrative smartphone and tablet computer industries.

headline.main: Microsoft’s AOL Deal Intensifies Patent Wars
headline.print_headline: Microsoft’s AOL Deal Intensifies Patent Wars

snippet: Neil LaBute and Sharr White are among the other playwrights trying out new work in staged readings for the Cape Cod Theater Project.
abstract: Neil LaBute and Sharr White are among the other playwrights trying out new work in staged readings for the Cape Cod Theater Project.

headline.main: Mike Daisey to Develop New Work With Cape Cod Theater Project
headline.print_headline: A New Mike Daisey Work For Cape Cod Theater

snippet: I was a guest on "Up w/Chris Hayes" Saturday, and since we didn't get to a tenth of what I wanted to discuss, I thought it worth posting.
abstract: I was a guest on "Up w/Chris Hayes" Saturday, and since we didn't get to a tenth of what I wanted to discuss, I thought it worth posting.

headline.main: Live From the Cutting Room Floor

snippet: The season will include a musical version of “Giant” and new plays by Richard Nelson, Richard Foreman and Colman Domingo.
abstract: The season will include a musical version of “Giant” and new plays by Richard Nelson, Richard Foreman and Colman Domingo.

headline.main: Musical by David Byrne and Fatboy Slim Part of Next Public Theater Season
headline.print_headline: From Edna Ferber to Imelda Marcos at the Public

snippet: Facebook said it would make its largest acquisition yet, buying Instagram, a social network built around photography and an out-of-nowhere Internet hit.
abstract: Facebook said it would make its largest acquisition yet, buying Instagram, a social network built around photography and an out-of-nowhere Internet hit.

headline.main: Facebook to Buy Photo-Sharing Service Instagram for $1 Billion
headline.print_headline: Facebook To Buy Mobile Start-Up For $1 Billion

snippet: AOL's $1.1 billion patent deal with Microsoft shows that a gold rush for technology rights continues, as companies seek to build up their stores of intellectual property.
abstract: AOL's $1.1 billion patent deal with Microsoft shows that a gold rush for technology rights continues, as companies seek to build up their stores of intellectual property.

headline.main: AOL-Microsoft Deal Shows Patent Frenzy Remains Strong

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED
